title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring surveillance, totalitarianism, and the erosion of truth in a society ruled by an omnipresent authoritarian regime.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic novel that examines social class, marriage, and personal growth through sharp wit and memorable characters.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping history of humankind that connects biology, anthropology, and history to explain how societies evolved.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic science fiction story about politics, religion, ecology, and power struggles on a desert planet called Arrakis.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure following a reluctant hero who embarks on a journey that shapes the fate of an entire world.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A magical realism masterpiece chronicling generations of a family, blending myth, memory, and history.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: A collection of personal philosophical reflections on stoicism, duty, self-discipline, and the nature of life.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A foundational science fiction novel exploring the rise and fall of civilizations through mathematics and prediction.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story about justice, race, and moral growth seen through the eyes of a child in the American South.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A psychological horror novel that delves into isolation, madness, and the supernatural within a haunted hotel.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A philosophical novel exploring absurdism, existentialism, and the emotional detachment of its protagonist.

title: Outliers
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: An exploration of human behavior, decision-making, and the hidden patterns that shape success and failure.

title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A humorous science fiction adventure blending absurdity, satire, and cosmic travel across the universe.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic novel that examines creation, responsibility, and humanity through a tragic scientific experiment.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: A concise military strategy treatise offering timeless insights into leadership, planning, and conflict.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: An emotional novel about friendship, guilt, and redemption set against decades of political turmoil.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A modern fantasy weaving mythology, gods, and contemporary America into a richly imaginative narrative.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic tale of ambition, wealth, and illusion during the Jazz Age, centered on the American Dream.

title: The Demon-Haunted World
author: Carl Sagan
description: A science-focused book encouraging critical thinking, skepticism, and curiosity about the universe.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about self-discovery, destiny, and following one’s personal legend.
